Description.value: A multi-level capability model for a university, derived from analysis of university websites.

systems.Description: Manages the end-to-end lifecycle of students from application to graduation and alumni.
Handles prospective student applications and admissions decisions.
Maintains applicant personal, identity and history data.
Captures core personal and contact information for applicants.
Captures and manages identity evidence for applicants.
Tracks applications and decisions across cycles.
Verifies prior academic qualifications presented by applicants.
Stores personal statements submitted by applicants.
Captures and stores references or recommendations for applicants.
Evaluates applicants against academic and other entry requirements.
Captures application form data and supporting information.
Assesses applications and makes recommendations.
Creates and manages offers to applicants.
Defines conditions associated with conditional offers.
Issues unconditional offers to eligible applicants.
Tracks applicant responses to offers.
Manages deposits associated with offer acceptance.
Tracks readiness for issuing CAS or equivalent.
Defines and manages rules for withdrawing offers.
Manages communications with applicants throughout the admissions process.
Governs decision-making for admissions including approvals and audit trail.
Validates that applicants have met the conditions of conditional offers.
Manages documents associated with admissions and applications.
Registers and onboards new students into the institution.
Verifies identity of new students for registration.
Verifies student photographs.
Verifies identity documents such as passports and visas.
Validates passport or other identification documents.
Validates visa documentation where required.
Manages the registration status of new students.
Collects required documentation from new students.
Plans and manages induction for new students.
Defines the structure and content of induction programmes.
Schedules induction and orientation sessions.
Manages content for academic induction.
Coordinates welcome events and activities.
Provides safety and wellbeing briefings to new students.
Confirms eligibility for student finance and funding during onboarding.
Performs pre-arrival checks such as immigration, fees and prerequisites.
Administers student enrolment and ongoing programme-level data.
Enables students to select modules within rules and constraints.
Publishes available modules and associated information.
Enforces enrolment rules for module selection.
Applies capacity limits for modules.
Routes module selection for academic approval where required.
Detects timetable clashes and preclusion conflicts.
Manages enrolment of students into programmes and years of study.
Validates co-requisite and pre-requisite requirements for enrolment.
Manages changes to student status such as intermission or transfer.
Manages periods of intermission or suspension of studies.
Manages programme or institution transfer processes.
Validates eligibility for status changes or transfers.
Assesses financial impacts of status changes.
Assesses visa implications of status changes for international students.
Tracks student attendance and engagement for academic and compliance purposes.
Manages academic progression decisions and graduation.
Defines and manages rules governing academic progression.
Configures progression criteria for programmes and stages.
Defines credit thresholds required for progression.
Defines rules for handling failed modules for progression.
Defines rules on compensating marginal failures.
Governs academic boards and exam boards for progression and awards.
Automates eligibility checking for progression and awards.
Manages algorithms and decisions for award classifications.
Configures the algorithms used for calculating classifications.
Defines weighted averaging rules for marks and credits.
Defines rules for borderline classification reviews.
Defines and manages overrides for exceptional cases.
Plans and manages graduation ceremonies and associated logistics.
Defines, delivers and governs assessments and academic academic processes.
Designs and configures assessment structures, rules and accessibility parameters.
Defines assessment types, purposes and attempts.
Defines available assessment types such as exam, coursework, presentation.
Maintains the taxonomy of assessment method types.
Defines the purpose of assessments.
Defines parameters distinguishing formative and summative assessments.
Defines allowed assessment attempts.
Defines rules for first sits, resits and repeats.
Manages weighting of assessments within modules and programmes.
Manages timing and scheduling of assessments and exams.
Defines marking rubrics and assessment criteria.
Configures accessibility requirements and adjustments for assessments.
Enables students to submit assessments and manages handling of submitted work.
Creates and manages assessment submission points and channels.
Validates submissions before acceptance.
Validates file types and sizes for submission.
Manages version control and timestamps for submissions.
Evaluates submissions against late submission policies.
Detects corrupted or unreadable files.
Enables detection of academic integrity issues such as plagiarism.
Provides receipts and confirmations for submitted work.
Manages marking, moderation and feedback publication.
Enables and controls entry of marks for assessments.
Enables and controls anonymous marking processes.
Configures and supports internal and external moderation.
Assigns first and second markers to assessments.
Defines thresholds for mark discrepancies requiring resolution.
Defines triggers for external examiner review.
Manages publication of assessment feedback and marks to students.
Resolves escalated assessment issues and governs assessment policies and procedures.
Adjudicates suspected academic misconduct cases.
Collects evidence for academic misconduct cases.
Captures plagiarism and similarity reports.
Captures statements from markers and witnesses.
Governs panel decision-making.
Defines penalty bands for academic misconduct.
Reviews mitigating factors in misconduct cases.
Enables and governs appeals against academic decisions.
Validates eligibility for resits and repeats.
Governs retention and disposal of assessment records and artefacts.
Provides wellbeing, disability, casework and immigration support to students.
Provides wellbeing and mental health triage, support and crisis management.
Assesses initial wellbeing requests and directs them appropriately.
Assesses risk for wellbeing and mental health cases.
Defines risk categories for wellbeing cases.
Enables protocols for suicidal ideation risk.
Defines conditions that trigger immediate safeguarding action.
Enables scheduling of wellbeing and mental health appointments.
Creates, maintains and reviews wellbeing support plans.
Enables escalation pathways for students in crisis.
Provides disability-related support, adjustments and assistive technology.
Enables assessment of students' disability and accessibility needs.
Plans and maintains reasonable adjustments for disabled students.
Defines types of reasonable adjustments.
Configures extra time adjustments for assessments.
Defines and configures alternative assessment formats.
Maintains adjustment agreements over time.
Manages review cycles for adjustments.
Provides assistive technologies and support for disabled students.
Collects and manages evidence required for accessibility support.
Manages complex advice and casework for students.
Captures and logs student casework and advisory requests.
Defines rules to prioritise student cases.
Defines levels of case severity.
Categorises case urgency.
Categorises case impact.
Enables referral of cases to multiple departments or services.
Documents outcomes and resolutions of student casework.
Provides support and compliance management for student visas and immigration.
Assesses eligibility for Confirmation of Acceptance for Study (CAS) or equivalent.
Monitors compliance with visa requirements.
Enables attendance monitoring for visa students.
Defines attendance thresholds for sponsored students.
Manages queries from international students regarding visas and immigration.
Enhances student experience through events, careers and global opportunities.
Plans and delivers student community events and engagement activities.
Provides careers guidance, employer engagement and opportunities.
Manages study abroad, exchanges and global mobility programmes.
Provides accommodation and living support for students.
Manages applications for and allocation of university accommodation.
Provides residence life and welfare support in accommodation.
Delivers maintenance and essential services to residences.
Designs, approves and maintains academic programmes, modules and timetables.
Designs and approves academic programmes and structures.
Maintains catalogue of approved modules and specifications.
Constructs teaching timetables and allocates rooms.
Provides digital infrastructure, platforms and IT support.
Manages user identities and access rights.
Provides support and incident management for IT services.
Runs networks, compute, storage and related infrastructure.
Supports core administrative and academic systems.
Manages the staff lifecycle, reward and development.
Recruits and onboards staff.
Manages pay, pensions and staff benefits.
Manages staff performance and development.
Manages financial accounting, control and procurement processes.
Maintains ledgers, controls and reports.
Manages procurement processes and supplier relationships.
Plans, operates and maintains the physical estate and facilities.
Delivers planned and reactive maintenance.
Provides security and safety services on campus.
Provides access to learning resources and study spaces.
Acquires and manages library materials and collections.
Provides access, loans and study facilities to users.
Provides institutional governance, risk management and compliance oversight.
Develops, maintains and communicates policies and regulations.
Identifies and manages institutional risks and assurance activities.
Manages data protection and records practices.
